body.p:
Covington Ky December 3d 1862
To his Excellency the Govenor of Kentucky

Sir At the request of Mr Amaziah Brafford who is a verry worthy industrious citizen and who feells a deep solicitude for his unfortunate Brother who is an inmate of the penitentiary for cutting one David Macullough which resulted in his Death we would say that we have been personally acquainted with this young Man from his small Boyhood and believe that it was done in suden heat and passion without any malice or thought of killing his victim. it is true that he was under the influence of Liquor being on the 22nd day of February, and had he been sober this difficulty would not have occured. the young Man is industrious and not given to habits of Idleness and Dissepation therefor we feell willing to Join in asking a full pardon believing that the Law has been fully vindicated and the punishment inflicted sufficient to restrain Lafayette Brafford from all future violence, and hope that you may ^find^ him a worthy and fit subject for executive clemency with high regard we are sir your obedient Servants.

Clinton Butts M C C
A, H, Herod Jailer
